content.description:
This corner crack system is broken up by a series of ledges, and then ends in a fun traverse out left to the far left edge. Route finishes with a tree belay up top. Ledges allow for plenty of rest, so the difficulties are all short lived.

To get down either rappel from one of the large trees or walk down and around same as for original approach. Can set up a rap anchor and recollect it at the end of the climbing day. (cars are on other side of fence from top out).
Trad climb. Most pieces are hand-size and smaller. No special considerations for gear.

Sandstone Crag that was once a quarry that closed roughly eight decades ago. Blocks of Sandstone from this very quarry were used in the Victoria Parliament building. Recent cleaning efforts are slowly establishing new routes as the quarry has not previously been recreationally used. The sandstone here is not bomber, so no bolting has yet been undertaken and climbs are currently all trad or toprope. Heavily treed area that provides a cool atmosphere in the heat of the summer, but requires good dry spells before the rock is climb-ready.
